pinyin: Nuo4 bei4 er3 He2 ping2 jiang3

definition: to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: He himself is a perennial Nobel also-ran.
sentences.chinese: 他自己就长年是诺贝尔和平奖落选者。

sentences.english: Nominations for the Nobel Peace Prize are not open to the public.
sentences.chinese: 为诺贝尔和平奖的提名是不向公众开放的。

sentences.english: And that's why the next Nobel Peace Prize should go to the Net.
sentences.chinese: 这就是下一届诺贝尔和平奖应该办法给互联网的原因。

sentences.english: So how did I feel when I was actually awarded the Nobel Prize for Peace?
sentences.chinese: 那当我真的获得诺贝尔和平奖之后是什么感觉呢？

sentences.english: Mother Teresa won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1979.
sentences.chinese: 德蕾莎修女在一九七九年获得诺贝尔和平奖。

sentences.english: I have a question concerning the Nobel Prize for Peace.
sentences.chinese: 我想请问一个关于诺贝尔和平奖的问题。

sentences.english: Do you think the Internet should be awarded the Nobel Peace Prize?
sentences.chinese: 你认为英特网应该获得这次的诺贝尔和平奖么？

sentences.english: And now Obama is the Nobel Peace Prize winner.
sentences.chinese: 现在，奥巴马是诺贝尔和平奖获得者了。

sentences.english: Ann: Yes, the Nobel Peace Prize is an inhibiting magic phrase.
sentences.chinese: 对啊，诺贝尔和平奖就是紧箍咒。

sentences.english: China thinks nothing of jailing a Nobel laureate and threatening trade sanctions against countries that attend the prize ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 中国则会阻止其诺贝尔和平奖获奖者参加颁奖仪式。

sentences.english: What follows is the process of his being awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1964.
sentences.chinese: 以下是他被颁赠一九六四年诺贝尔和平奖的过程。

sentences.english: WESTLIFE sends their congratulations to President Kim Daejung on winning the Nobel Peace prize.
sentences.chinese: 西城男孩向金大中主席恭贺他获得诺贝尔和平奖。

sentences.english: Lin, you should win a Nobel Peace Prize sometimes in your life time.
sentences.chinese: 林，你应该在有生之年获得诺贝尔和平奖。

sentences.english: In your opinion, what's the main reason that you were honored the Nobel Prize for Peace?
sentences.chinese: 依您之见，您获得诺贝尔和平奖的主要原因是什么？

sentences.english: He was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1990.
sentences.chinese: 1990年，戈氏被授予诺贝尔和平奖。

sentences.english: Indeed, the reasoning behind the awarding of the prize to previous American presidents has been easier to discern.
sentences.chinese: 之前几位获得诺贝尔和平奖的美国总统的确实至名归。

pinyin: Nuo4 bei4 er3 Wen2 xue2 Jiang3

definition: Nobel Prize/abbr. for 諾貝爾獎|诺贝尔奖[Nuo4 bei4 er3 Jiang3]
Sakharov Prize for Freedom of Thought (awarded by EU since 1988)
António Guterres (1949-), secretary-general of the United Nations (2017-), prime minister of Portugal (1995-2002)

pinyin: ming2 yu4 bo2 shi4 xue2 wei4

definition: Barack Obama (1961-), US Democrat politician, president 2009-2017
Martin Luther King, Jr. (1929-1968), American clergyman and civil rights activist
Aung San Suu Kyi (1945-), Myanmar opposition leader and 1991 Nobel Peace laureate/also written 昂山素姬
